body: +1, hitting the same. I think the original poster is spot on. It doesn't seem to be using the correct schema on the query.

Same problem here. For a schema called `int_location`

```
console.log node_modules/typeorm/platform/PlatformTools.js:212
query failed: CREATE TABLE "int_location"."auth" (
  "uuid" uuid NOT NULL DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(), 
  "role" "auth_role_enum"NOT NULL,
...
```

```
console.log node_modules/typeorm/platform/PlatformTools.js:212
      error: { error: type "auth_role_enum" does not exist
...
```

I guess the schema has to be appended as well to `auth_role_enum`.


Happening with `synchronize` and `dropBeforeSync` set to `true`

This also seems to happen for enums mapped to integers when syncing the Entities to the database. 
I'm using TypeORM version 0.2.7.

For example, if we take the following enum:

```
enum Position {
    LEFT = 1,
    MIDDLE = 2,
    RIGHT = 3
}
```

Then add an enum type field with a default value to an Entity:
```
  @Column("enum", {
    enum: Position,
    default: Position[Position.LEFT]
  })
  position: Position;
```

This leads to the following error:

```
(node:23088) UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: QueryFailedError: invalid input value for enum user_position_enum: "LEFT"
```

If we adjust the default to the integer value:
```
  @Column("enum", {
    enum: Position,
    default: Position.LEFT
  })
  position: Position;
```

We still get an error:
```
(node:23198) UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: QueryFailedError: column "position" is of type user_position_enum but default expression is of type integer
```

@abcd-ca it works if you are not using schemas
this does not work:
```
export enum Status {
  ACTIVE = "active",
  INACTIVE = "inactive",
}

@Entity({schema: "test"})
export class User {
  @PrimaryGeneratedColumn()
  id: number;

  @Column("enum", { enum: Status, default: Status.ACTIVE })
  status: Status;
}
```
Generated SQL
```
CREATE TYPE "test"."user_status_enum" AS ENUM('active', 'inactive');
CREATE TABLE "test"."user" ("id" SERIAL NOT NULL, "status" "user_status_enum" NOT NULL DEFAULT 'active', CONSTRAINT "PK_a28028ba709cd7e5053a86857b4" PRIMARY KEY ("id"));
```
The enum is correctly created in the schema but the create table does not reference it correctly.

Fixing the migration for creating the table is easy, but because of this bug any further automatic migration generation breaks because it cannot find the enum in the database as it does not search for it in the schema.

```
$ npx typeorm migration:generate -n test
Error during migration generation:
{ QueryFailedError: type "user_status_enum" does not exist
    at new QueryFailedError (/Users/evik/etheal/doklist-data-backend/node_modules/typeorm/error/QueryFailedError.js:27:28)
    at Query.<anonymous> (/Users/evik/etheal/doklist-data-backend/node_modules/typeorm/driver/postgres/PostgresQueryRunner.js:212:38)
    at Query.handleError (/Users/evik/etheal/doklist-data-backend/node_modules/pg/lib/query.js:143:17)
    at Connection.connectedErrorHandler (/Users/evik/etheal/doklist-data-backend/node_modules/pg/lib/client.js:132:26)
    at Connection.emit (events.js:182:13)
    at Socket.<anonymous> (/Users/evik/etheal/doklist-data-backend/node_modules/pg/lib/connection.js:123:12)
    at Socket.emit (events.js:182:13)
    at addChunk (_stream_readable.js:283:12)
    at readableAddChunk (_stream_readable.js:264:11)
    at Socket.Readable.push (_stream_readable.js:219:10)
  message: 'type "user_status_enum" does not exist',
  name: 'QueryFailedError',
  length: 102,
  severity: 'ERROR',
  code: '42704',
  detail: undefined,
  hint: undefined,
  position: undefined,
  internalPosition: undefined,
  internalQuery: undefined,
  where: undefined,
  schema: undefined,
  table: undefined,
  column: undefined,
  dataType: undefined,
  constraint: undefined,
  file: 'parse_type.c',
  line: '797',
  routine: 'parseTypeString',
  query:
   'SELECT *, "udt_name"::"regtype" AS "regtype" FROM "information_schema"."columns" WHERE ("table_schema" = \'test\' AND "table_name" = \'user\')',
  parameters: [] }
```

issue.title: Error reverting migration with enum postgres

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

body: @Kononnable what do I need to do to get my [PR](https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/pull/2746/) checked for this?
@pleerock planned to release 0.2.8 and merge some PR's this weekend. Not sure if that will be merged today, but we're planning to slowly merge them all.
can somebody test @evik42 's changes to make sure everything is right and we can merge it?
@pleerock I added all the previous enum tests with external schema as part of the PR, I also used this by manually patching typeorm in prod, let me know how I can assist to move this forward.
